title: Submarine Lab Adventure #6
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Deep Sea Research Laboratory
rooms.description: A cramped underwater laboratory filled with scientific equipment and blinking monitors. Through the reinforced porthole, you see the dark ocean depths and bioluminescent creatures drifting past. Emergency lights cast an eerie red glow. The air smells of recycled oxygen and electronics.

items.name: main research computer
items.description: A computer terminal displaying various research data and logs
items.text: RESEARCH LOG - Dr. Sarah Chen, Lead Scientist. Project started: 03/15/2024. Depth: 3152 meters. Mission: Study deep-sea organisms. Emergency protocol: All personnel must know the facility director's name, our depth, and the location of backup oxygen.

items.name: equipment storage cabinet
items.description: A tall metal cabinet with multiple compartments for storing lab equipment

items.name: research notebook
items.description: A waterproof notebook filled with scientific observations
items.text: Dr. Chen's Notes: Remember the facility depth for the equipment cabinet - 3152 meters. Director Martinez oversees all operations. The specimen freezer requires the master key from the storage bay.

items.name: security access card
items.description: A magnetic keycard labeled 'AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY'

items.name: research microscope station
items.description: A workstation with a high-powered microscope and sample slides

items.name: specimen log
items.description: A document cataloging collected samples
items.text: SPECIMEN LOG: Sample 47B collected from thermal vent. Unusual bioluminescent properties. Storage location: Specimen freezer in equipment bay. Note: Backup oxygen tanks stored in equipment bay lockers.

items.name: specimen freezer unit
items.description: A locked freezer containing biological samples

items.name: emergency locator beacon
items.description: A device that signals rescue teams - essential for escape

items.name: pressure-sealed door
items.description: A heavy door with a card reader leading to the equipment bay

rooms.name: Equipment Storage Bay
rooms.description: A utilitarian storage area lined with metal lockers and supply crates. Diving suits hang on the walls, and oxygen tanks are secured in racks. A maintenance panel blinks with warning lights. The hum of life support systems fills the air.

items.name: personnel information board
items.description: A board displaying crew member profiles and photos
items.text: CREW ROSTER: Director Carlos Martinez - Facility Commander. Dr. Sarah Chen - Lead Researcher. Engineer James Park - Maintenance and Systems. Dr. Lisa Wong - Marine Biologist.

items.name: supply locker
items.description: A large locker containing various equipment and supplies

items.name: master key
items.description: A key labeled 'MASTER - ALL STORAGE UNITS'

items.name: facility maintenance manual
items.description: A technical manual with emergency procedures
items.text: EMERGENCY PROCEDURES: In case of evacuation, proceed to escape pod bay. Access requires security clearance. Emergency questions verify identity: Who is the facility director? What is our operational depth? Where are backup oxygen tanks stored?

items.name: oxygen tank rack
items.description: A rack holding emergency oxygen tanks
items.text: EMERGENCY OXYGEN STORAGE - Equipment Bay Lockers. Tanks checked and certified by Engineer Park.

items.name: engineer's tool chest
items.description: A heavy toolbox with various repair equipment

items.name: heavy-duty wire cutters
items.description: Industrial wire cutters for cutting through obstacles

items.name: escape pod bay hatch
items.description: A reinforced hatch leading to the escape pod bay. A security terminal displays three verification questions.

password_questions.question: Who is the facility director?
password_questions.hint: Check the personnel board in the equipment bay

password_questions.question: What is the operational depth in meters?
password_questions.hint: The research computer log mentions the facility depth

password_questions.question: Where are backup oxygen tanks stored?
password_questions.hint: Look at the specimen log and oxygen rack information

rooms.name: Emergency Escape Pod Bay
rooms.description: You've reached the escape pod bay! A sleek emergency escape pod sits in its launch tube, ready for deployment. Control panels glow with green ready lights. Through the launch window, you can see the dark ocean waiting. The emergency beacon in your possession will guide rescue teams to your location.

items.name: emergency escape pod
items.description: A small submarine designed for emergency evacuation to the surface

items.name: pod launch controls
items.description: The control panel for launching the escape pod, all systems showing green

items.name: emergency radio
items.description: A radio system for contacting surface vessels once you reach safe depth

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You board the escape pod with the emergency beacon and initiate launch sequence. The pod detaches and begins its ascent through the dark waters. As you rise toward the surface, the beacon transmits your location to rescue teams. The pressure decreases, light begins to filter down from above, and soon you'll break through to safety. You've escaped the submarine lab! You win!
